description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b64sr","text":"Das Protokoll beschreibt die In-Kulturnahme von Bacterial stabs zur Anreicherung einzelner Klone und zur Produktion von ausreichend Bakterien zur Gewinnung der gewünschten Plasmide mittels Maxi Prep.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines:
{"blocks":[{"key":"6nc4s","text":"Addgene ships plasmids as transformed bacteria in stab culture format. A stab culture is a type of Luria Broth (LB) Agar media, similar to a standard LB Agar plate. Unlike an LB Agar plate, a stab culture is created by piercing the LB agar with the bacteria instead of spreading it on the surface. The bacteria in a stab culture grow from the puncture site to spread across the surface of the stab culture.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9d978","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9e8h4","text":"Short Term Storage ofBacterial Stab","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1535","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15ilk","text":"Stab cultures should be stored at 4°C upon receipt. The bacteria in the stab is guaranteed to live for at least 2 weeks when stored at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":24,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6u5mh","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbkrn","text":"Long Term Storage - Isolating and Verifying the Plasmid and Creating a Glycerol Stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":85}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cea2e","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fah4p","text":"Within 2 weeks of receiving your new Addgene plasmid you should verify that the plasmid is correct and create a glycerol stock. Please follow Addgene’s recommended protocols below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6822e","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"deks8","text":"1.       Streak Bacteria for Single Colonies - use your bacterial stab to streak bacteria onto a plate, grow overnight, and isolate single colonies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":35}],"data":{}},{"key":"n8on","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5uipd","text":"2.       Select an isolated, single colony to inoculate an overnight culture. Using a liquid culture will allow you to grow enough
bacteria for plasmid DNA purification and for creating glycerol stocks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":46,"length":30},{"key":2,"offset":177,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"29l4","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h7hs","text":"1.       Addgene recommends selecting and inoculating 2-4 separate colonies for plasmid screening and verification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejcu3","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"826u2","text":"3.       Isolate your Plasmid DNA - many companies sell miniprep or maxiprep kits for easy plasmid isolation. Addgene also provides a protocol for plasmid purification without a kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":9,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"7dqc2","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qri1","text":"4.       After isolating plasmid DNA, Addgene recommends verifying the plasmid by diagnostic digest or sequencing before beginning any experiments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42df0","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3a9lm","text":"1.       Perform a Diagnostic Digest - verify backbone and insert sizes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":9,"length":27}],"data":{}},{"key":"5358b","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"270ig","text":"2.       Sequence your Plasmid - verify key regions of the plasmid using DNA sequencing and compare these to sequences Addgene obtained from the plasmid, found on the plasmid page under “Sequences”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":9,"length":21}],"data":{}},{"key":"b3nut","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bg6t","text":"3.       After screening 2-4 colonies, if you find that your plasmid DNA is not correct, please view the instructions on how to report a problem with a plasmid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":128,"length":31}],"data":{}},{"key":"2lqqr","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjca1","text":"5.       Once you have verified that the plasmid DNA is correct, keep the glycerol stocks corresponding to the colony that was
verified- most plasmids are stable for years when stored as bacterial glycerol stocks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/streak-plate"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/inoculate-bacterial-culture"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/create-glycerol-stock"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/purify-plasmid-dna"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/diagnostic-digest"}},"5":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/sequence-analysis"}},"6":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://help.addgene.org/hc/en-us/articles/205433649-There-is-a-problem-with-the-plasmid-I-received-"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bh8ui","text":"Ampicillin:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bg1nl","text":"100 mg/ml in sterilem H2O lösen; sterilfiltrieren, aliq.; - 20 °C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4iq5","text":"1:1000 zu dem Platten bzw. Medium =\u003e 100 µg/ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"192ij","text":"Agarplatten gießen:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64goi","text":"10 cm Greiner-Schalen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"foh3m","text":"1,5 g Agar auf 100 ml LB-Broth-Medium o. 3,5 g LB Agar auf 100 ml ddH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crl1a","text":"aufkochen, abkühlen auf 50 °C im Wasserbad","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1c5ur","text":"unter der Bench + AB; gießen (3-4 mm hoch)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eav9e","text":"reicht für ca. 4-5 Platten ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50n02","text":"gegossene Platten im Kühlschrank in Plastiktüte über Kopf lagern","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fqe62","text":"Bacterial stab mit steriler Pipettespitze auf den Agarplatten ausstreichen; trocknen lassen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ectt9","text":"mit einer sterilen Pipettenspitze Klone picken und im 15 ml Falcontube in ca.   Medium/ mit AB einbringen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":78,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4k759","text":"bei  im Schüttelinkubator für einige Stunden anziehen (Deckel leicht geöffnet)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":3,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78ar5","text":"restliche Platte mit Parafilm abdichten; als Backup im Kühlschrank in Plastiktüte über Kopf lagern","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0enr","text":"  auf  Medium/ mit AB in 250 ml Erlenmeyerkolben mit leicht geöffneter Alufolie als Deckel;   bei   im Wasserbad schütteln\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":6,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":92,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":98,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"250","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bc5g8","text":"Zellen abzentrifugieren     und zur Plasmidisolierung weiter mit Protokoll:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":26,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7srbe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"akvbl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"4000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":true,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":32,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
